result.execSummary:
The defendant Barton George Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barton George Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barton George Scott was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 - 6.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 8, 2016.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota if Agent deems necessary.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs, apply bond on file.
Balance of $99.08 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF246.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF246.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation and follow through with recommendations.

-Defendant to participate in any other programming recommended by the Agent.
-Defendant to sign up for Sex Offender Registration and reporting for not less than 10 years.
-At expiration of 10 years the Court has the right to re-examine.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with any juvenile female under the age of 18 years except for family.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with the named individuals and their families that are named on the bond during the length of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time.
To be served 2 months per year of Probation.
Huber granted for work.
Sentence to commence within 60 days of Probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham July 5, 2018 - amend credit.

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with any juvenile female under the age of 18 years with the exception of family and the Victims noted in St. Croix County Case #14CF246.
-Defendant to maintain treatment for deviancy with the help of the department in exploring alternative treatment options.
-Any other Programs the Agent believes is necessary.
-Defendant not to use the Internet.
-Defendant no to use any social media.
-Defendant no to use a cell phone or any other device with Internet capabilities.
-Comply with Sex Registry.
-Pay Supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. DA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: T. Gregory Amann DF: Barton George Scott appeared from jail. Case called at 11:37. Court reviews file. DA Nieskes updates the court and makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty. Amann makes sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement.Court orders:
3 years  6 months total incarceration
1 year 6 months initial
2 years ES with conditions

- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the an juvenile female under the age of 18 with the exception of family and the victims noted in St. Croix case number 14CF246. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- DE to maintain treatment for deviency with the dept. help in exploring alternative treatment options.
- Any other programs the agent believes is necessary. 
- DE not to use the internet.
- DE not to use any social media. 
- DE not to use a cell phone or any other device with internet capabilities. 
- DE to comply with sex registry.
- Costs of supervison.

Court notes 178 days credit. 
DE is remanded for reception at Dodge Correctional Facility.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Kate Mary Murtaugh DF:  Barton George Scott appeared. Case called at 10:05. Court reviews fines and penalties. Court reviewed completed PSI completed by Agent Anderson and an alternative PSI completed by Bill Weaver. Atty. Murtaugh argues Cts 2-6 are to be used in argument for registration and believes the agent has used these charges to determine confinement. ADA Nieskes responds. Atty. Murtaugh responds. Court will use counts 2-6 for registration purposes only and not use the agents recommendations for sentencing. Court will direct Agent Anderson to prepare an amended PSI for Ct. 2-6 to be used for registration only to the court within 10 days. Court questions any corrections in PSI. ADA Nieskes makes sentencing recommendations. Atty. Murray reads a statement. Atty. Murtaugh makes sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Court orders: Sentence W/H 3 years probation 
- 6 months in St. Croix County Jail condition time. To be served 2 months per year of proabation.
  Huber granted for work.
 Jail to  commence within the first 60 days of probation. 
- DE to obtain a psychological deviency evaluation and follow any recommended follow through.
- DE to participate in any other programming recommended by the agent. 
- DE to sign up for sex offender registration and reporting for not less than 10 years. At expiration at 10 years the court has the right 
   to re examine. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
-DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with any juvenile female under the age of 18 except for family. And no contact with the named individuals and their families that are named on the bond during the length of probation. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- $1000 fine inclusive of costs. 
  Apply bond on file. 

DE to sign up for probation today. Probation may be transferred to MN if the agent deems necessary.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Kate Mary Murtaugh DF: Barton George Scott appeared. Case called at 3:17. ADA Nieskes updates the court. The State has filed an Amended Information adding a new count 1. Atty. Murtaugh agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct. 1  in the amended informaton. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Atty's stipulate to the Count that pertains to KTM. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in the Amended Informaton. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2,3,4,5 and 6 in 14CF246 but is free to use those facts to use in argument for registry. Crt orders a PSI to be completed within 60 days. Bond continues in form and amount.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

signed by EFV 6/20/14. eif

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E.K.S. dob 1/19/1996, K.M.A. dob 3/31/1999, K.T.M. dob 7/10/1998 & A.A.A. dob 2/12/1998 or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
